articles.author: KARIN LAUB, NAJIB JOBAIN and JACK JEFFERY
articles.description: RAMALLAH, West Bank (AP) — The Israeli military on Friday mistakenly killed three Israeli hostages during its ground operation in the Gaza Strip, military officials said.The army’s chief spokesman, Rear Adm.
articles.title: Israeli military says it mistakenly killed 3 Israeli hostages in Gaza

articles.author: THOMAS BEAUMONT and HANNAH FINGERHUT
articles.description: CORALVILLE, Iowa (AP) — Donald Trump was uncharacteristically serious when he implored an audience in eastern Iowa to carry him to a blowout in next month's Republican caucuses. “The margin of victory is very important, it's just very important,” Trump told about 1,000 people attending a Wednesday rally aimed at organizing campaign volunteers.
articles.title: With Iowa's caucuses a month away, Trump urges voters to hand him not just a victory, but a blowout

articles.author: KEVIN FREKING
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The United States experienced a dramatic 12% increase in homelessness to its highest reported level as soaring rents and a decline in coronavirus pandemic assistance combined to put housing out of reach for more Americans, federal officials said Friday.
articles.title: US homelessness up 12% to highest reported level as rents soar and coronavirus pandemic aid lapses

articles.author: JON GAMBRELL
articles.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — A boy, his face coated in fresh blood, screams as rescuers try to pull him out of the rubble of a destroyed building following an Israeli airstrike in Gaza.
articles.title: A year of war: 2023 sees worst-ever Israel-Hamas combat as Russian attacks on Ukraine grind on

articles.author: PETER SMITH
articles.description: A quarter of U.S. congregations in the United Methodist Church have received permission to leave the denomination during a five-year window, closing this month, that authorized departures for congregations over disputes involving the church's LGBTQ-related policies.
articles.title: One fourth of United Methodist churches in US have left in schism over LGBTQ ban. What happens now?

articles.author: LINDSAY WHITEHURST and ALANNA DURKIN RICHER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Jurors on Friday began their second day of deliberations to decide how much Rudy Giuliani must pay two former Georgia election workers for spreading lies about them after the 2020 election that led to a barrage of racist threats and upended their lives.
articles.title: Georgia election workers' defamation case against Giuliani opens second day of damages deliberations

articles.author: BEN FINLEY and DENISE LAVOIE
articles.description: NEWPORT NEWS, Va. (AP) — The mother of a 6-year-old who shot his teacher in Virginia was sentenced Friday to two years in prison for felony child neglect, nearly a year after her son used her gun to critically wound the educator.
articles.title: Mother of 6-year-old who shot teacher in Virginia gets 2 years in prison for child neglect

articles.author: JOHN LEICESTER and JILL LAWLESS
articles.description: LE PECQ, France (AP) — The vehicle's headlights silhouetted the exhausted teenager walking alone in the rain in deepest rural France, with a skateboard tucked under his arm. “I said to myself, ‘That’s strange.
articles.title: Declared missing as a child, British teenager lives off-grid for 6 years, then pops up in France

articles.author: ALICIA RANCILIO
articles.description: There's a common phrase associated with Jack Reacher in Lee's Child's books: “Reacher says nothing.” Saying nothing, however, can be terrifying for Alan Ritchson, who plays Reacher on TV.
articles.title: 'Reacher' star Alan Ritchson talks season two of hit show and how 'Amazon took a risk' on him

articles.author: JOE REEDY
articles.description: Coach Brandon Staley and general manager Tom Telesco were fired by the Los Angeles Chargers on Friday morning after one of the worst losses in franchise history.The Chargers made the playoffs last season but are one of this year's biggest disappointments at 5-9, with losses in five of their last six games.
articles.title: Chargers fire coach Brandon Staley, general manager Tom Telesco in midst of disappointing season
